1.text: O Israel, return to the LORD your God; for you have fallen by your iniquity.

2.text: Take with you words, and turn to the LORD: say to him, Take away all iniquity, and receive us graciously: so will we render the calves of our lips.

3.text: Asshur shall not save us; we will not ride on horses: neither will we say any more to the work of our hands, You are our gods: for in you the fatherless finds mercy.

4.text: I will heal their backsliding, I will love them freely: for my anger is turned away from him.

5.text: I will be as the dew to Israel: he shall grow as the lily, and cast forth his roots as Lebanon.

6.text: His branches shall spread, and his beauty shall be as the olive tree, and his smell as Lebanon.

7.text: They that dwell under his shadow shall return; they shall revive as the corn, and grow as the vine: the scent thereof shall be as the wine of Lebanon.

8.text: Ephraim shall say, What have I to do any more with idols? I have heard him, and observed him: I am like a green fir tree. From me is your fruit found.

9.text: Who is wise, and he shall understand these things? prudent, and he shall know them? for the ways of the LORD are right, and the just shall walk in them: but the transgressors shall fall therein.
